author: Reuters Editorial
title: Putin, Erdogan discuss military coordination in Syria - Kremlin
text:
MOSCOW, Feb 8 (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin and Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan agreed to strengthen coordination between the two countriesâ€™ military and security services in Syria in the fight against terrorism, the Kremlin said in a statement.
Putin and Erdogan, in a telephone conversation, also discussed the prospects for new contacts between Russia, Turkey and Iran on Syria, the statement said.
Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said a possible summit meeting between the leaders of the three countries was discussed, but no date has been agreed, RIA news agency reported. (Reporting by Maria Kiseleva; Writing by Polina Nikolskaya; Editing by Christian Lowe)
